BatchGetApplications.documentation: Gets information about one or more applications.

BatchGetDeployments.documentation: Gets information about one or more deployments.

BatchGetOnPremisesInstances.documentation: Gets information about one or more on-premises instances.

CreateDeployment.documentation: Deploys an application revision through the specified deployment group.

CreateDeploymentGroup.documentation: Creates a new deployment group for application revisions to be deployed to.

DeleteDeploymentConfig.documentation:
Deletes a deployment configuration.

 A deployment configuration cannot be deleted if it is currently in use. Also, predefined configurations cannot be deleted.

GetApplicationRevision.documentation: Gets information about an application revision.

GetDeploymentConfig.documentation: Gets information about a deployment configuration.

GetDeploymentGroup.documentation: Gets information about a deployment group.

GetDeploymentInstance.documentation: Gets information about an instance as part of a deployment.

GetOnPremisesInstance.documentation: Gets information about an on-premises instance.

ListApplicationRevisions.documentation: Lists information about revisions for an application.

ListApplications.documentation: Lists the applications registered with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

ListDeploymentConfigs.documentation: Lists the deployment configurations with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

ListDeploymentGroups.documentation: Lists the deployment groups for an application registered with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

ListDeploymentInstances.documentation: Lists the instances for a deployment associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

ListDeployments.documentation: Lists the deployments within a deployment group for an application registered with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

ListOnPremisesInstances.documentation:
Gets a list of one or more on-premises instance names.

 Unless otherwise specified, both registered and deregistered on-premises instance names will be listed. To list only registered or deregistered on-premises instance names, use the registration status parameter.

RegisterApplicationRevision.documentation: Registers with AWS CodeDeploy a revision for the specified application.

RemoveTagsFromOnPremisesInstances.documentation: Removes one or more tags from one or more on-premises instances.

StopDeployment.documentation: Attempts to stop an ongoing deployment.

UpdateDeploymentGroup.documentation: Changes information about an existing deployment group.

AddTagsToOnPremisesInstancesInput.documentation: Represents the input of an adds tags to on-premises instance operation.

members.name: tags
members.documentation:
The tag key-value pairs to add to the on-premises instances.

Keys and values are both required. Keys cannot be nulls or empty strings. Value-only tags are not allowed.

members.name: instanceNames
members.documentation: The names of the on-premises instances to add tags to.

ApplicationAlreadyExistsException.documentation: An application with the specified name already exists with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

ApplicationDoesNotExistException.documentation: The application does not exist with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

members.name: applicationId
members.documentation: The application ID.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The application name.

members.name: createTime
members.documentation: The time that the application was created.

members.name: linkedToGitHub
members.documentation: True if the user has authenticated with GitHub for the specified application; otherwise, false.

ApplicationLimitExceededException.documentation: More applications were attempted to be created than were allowed.

ApplicationNameRequiredException.documentation: The minimum number of required application names was not specified.

AutoScalingGroup.documentation: Information about an Auto Scaling group.

members.name: name
members.documentation: The Auto Scaling group name.

members.name: hook
members.documentation: An Auto Scaling lifecycle event hook name.

BatchGetApplicationsInput.documentation: Represents the input of a batch get applications operation.

members.documentation: Information about the applications.

members.documentation: A list of deployment IDs, with multiple deployment IDs separated by spaces.

members.documentation: Information about the deployments.

members.documentation: Information about the on-premises instances.

BucketNameFilterRequiredException.documentation: A bucket name is required but was not provided.

CreateApplicationInput.documentation: Represents the input of a create application operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The name of the application. This name must be unique with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

CreateApplicationOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a create application operation.

members.name: applicationId
members.documentation: A unique application ID.

CreateDeploymentConfigInput.documentation: Represents the input of a create deployment configuration operation.

members.name: deploymentConfigName
members.documentation: The name of the deployment configuration to create.

members.name: minimumHealthyHosts
members.documentation:
The minimum number of healthy instances that should be available at any time during the deployment. There are two parameters expected in the input: type and value.

The type parameter takes either of the following values:

  • HOST_COUNT: The value parameter represents the minimum number of healthy instances, as an absolute value.
  • FLEET_PERCENT: The value parameter represents the minimum number of healthy instances, as a percentage of the total number of instances in the deployment. If you specify FLEET_PERCENT, then at the start of the deployment AWS CodeDeploy converts the percentage to the equivalent number of instances and rounds fractional instances up.

The value parameter takes an integer.

For example, to set a minimum of 95% healthy instances, specify a type of FLEET_PERCENT and a value of 95.

CreateDeploymentConfigOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a create deployment configuration operation.

members.name: deploymentConfigId
members.documentation: A unique deployment configuration ID.

CreateDeploymentGroupInput.documentation: Represents the input of a create deployment group operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The name of an existing AWS CodeDeploy application associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

members.name: deploymentGroupName
members.documentation: The name of an existing deployment group for the specified application.

members.name: deploymentConfigName
members.documentation:
If specified, the deployment configuration name must be one of the predefined values, or it can be a custom deployment configuration:

  • CodeDeployDefault.AllAtOnce deploys an application revision to up to all of the instances at once. The overall deployment succeeds if the application revision deploys to at least one of the instances. The overall deployment fails after the application revision fails to deploy to all of the instances. For example, for 9 instances, deploy to up to all 9 instances at once. The overall deployment succeeds if any of the 9 instances is successfully deployed to, and it fails if all 9 instances fail to be deployed to.
  • CodeDeployDefault.HalfAtATime deploys to up to half of the instances at a time (with fractions rounded down). The overall deployment succeeds if the application revision deploys to at least half of the instances (with fractions rounded up); otherwise, the deployment fails. For example, for 9 instances, deploy to up to 4 instances at a time. The overall deployment succeeds if 5 or more instances are successfully deployed to; otherwise, the deployment fails. Note that the deployment may successfully deploy to some instances, even if the overall deployment fails.
  • CodeDeployDefault.OneAtATime deploys the application revision to only one of the instances at a time. The overall deployment succeeds if the application revision deploys to all of the instances. The overall deployment fails after the application revision first fails to deploy to any one instances. For example, for 9 instances, deploy to one instance at a time. The overall deployment succeeds if all 9 instances are successfully deployed to, and it fails if any of one of the 9 instances fail to be deployed to. Note that the deployment may successfully deploy to some instances, even if the overall deployment fails. This is the default deployment configuration if a configuration isn't specified for either the deployment or the deployment group.

To create a custom deployment configuration, call the create deployment configuration operation.

members.name: ec2TagFilters
members.documentation: The Amazon EC2 tags to filter on.

members.name: onPremisesInstanceTagFilters
members.documentation: The on-premises instance tags to filter on.

members.name: autoScalingGroups
members.documentation: A list of associated Auto Scaling groups.

members.name: serviceRoleArn
members.documentation: A service role ARN that allows AWS CodeDeploy to act on the user's behalf when interacting with AWS services.

CreateDeploymentGroupOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a create deployment group operation.

members.name: deploymentGroupId
members.documentation: A unique deployment group ID.

CreateDeploymentInput.documentation: Represents the input of a create deployment operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The name of an existing AWS CodeDeploy application associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

members.name: deploymentGroupName
members.documentation: The deployment group's name.

members.name: revision
members.documentation: The type of revision to deploy, along with information about the revision's location.

members.name: deploymentConfigName
members.documentation:
The name of an existing deployment configuration associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

If not specified, the value configured in the deployment group will be used as the default. If the deployment group does not have a deployment configuration associated with it, then CodeDeployDefault.OneAtATime will be used by default.

members.name: description
members.documentation: A comment about the deployment.

members.name: ignoreApplicationStopFailures
members.documentation:
If set to true, then if the deployment causes the ApplicationStop deployment lifecycle event to fail to a specific instance, the deployment will not be considered to have failed to that instance at that point and will continue on to the BeforeInstall deployment lifecycle event.

If set to false or not specified, then if the deployment causes the ApplicationStop deployment lifecycle event to fail to a specific instance, the deployment will stop to that instance, and the deployment to that instance will be considered to have failed.

CreateDeploymentOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a create deployment operation.

members.name: deploymentId
members.documentation: A unique deployment ID.

DeleteApplicationInput.documentation: Represents the input of a delete application operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The name of an existing AWS CodeDeploy application associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

DeleteDeploymentConfigInput.documentation: Represents the input of a delete deployment configuration operation.

members.name: deploymentConfigName
members.documentation: The name of an existing deployment configuration associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

DeleteDeploymentGroupInput.documentation: Represents the input of a delete deployment group operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The name of an existing AWS CodeDeploy application associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

members.name: deploymentGroupName
members.documentation: The name of an existing deployment group for the specified application.

DeleteDeploymentGroupOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a delete deployment group operation.

members.name: hooksNotCleanedUp
members.documentation: If the output contains no data, and the corresponding deployment group contained at least one Auto Scaling group, AWS CodeDeploy successfully removed all corresponding Auto Scaling lifecycle event hooks from the Amazon EC2 instances in the Auto Scaling. If the output does contain data, AWS CodeDeploy could not remove some Auto Scaling lifecycle event hooks from the Amazon EC2 instances in the Auto Scaling group.

DeploymentConfigAlreadyExistsException.documentation: A deployment configuration with the specified name already exists with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

DeploymentConfigDoesNotExistException.documentation: The deployment configuration does not exist with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

DeploymentConfigInUseException.documentation: The deployment configuration is still in use.

members.name: deploymentConfigId
members.documentation: The deployment configuration ID.

members.name: deploymentConfigName
members.documentation: The deployment configuration name.

members.name: minimumHealthyHosts
members.documentation: Information about the number or percentage of minimum healthy instances.

members.name: createTime
members.documentation: The time that the deployment configuration was created.

DeploymentConfigLimitExceededException.documentation: The deployment configurations limit was exceeded.

DeploymentConfigNameRequiredException.documentation: The deployment configuration name was not specified.

DeploymentDoesNotExistException.documentation: The deployment does not exist with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

DeploymentGroupAlreadyExistsException.documentation: A deployment group with the specified name already exists with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

DeploymentGroupDoesNotExistException.documentation: The named deployment group does not exist with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The application name.

members.name: deploymentGroupId

members.name: deploymentGroupName
members.documentation: The deployment group name.

members.documentation: The Amazon EC2 tags to filter on.

members.name: onPremisesInstanceTagFilters
members.documentation: The on-premises instance tags to filter on.

members.name: autoScalingGroups
members.documentation: A list of associated Auto Scaling groups.

members.name: serviceRoleArn
members.documentation: A service role ARN.

members.name: targetRevision
members.documentation: Information about the deployment group's target revision, including the revision's type and its location.

DeploymentGroupLimitExceededException.documentation: The deployment groups limit was exceeded.

DeploymentGroupNameRequiredException.documentation: The deployment group name was not specified.

DeploymentIdRequiredException.documentation: At least one deployment ID must be specified.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The application name.

members.name: deploymentGroupName
members.documentation: The deployment group name.

members.name: deploymentConfigName
members.documentation: The deployment configuration name.

members.name: deploymentId
members.documentation: The deployment ID.

members.name: revision
members.documentation: Information about the location of application artifacts that are stored and the service to retrieve them from.

members.name: status
members.documentation: The current state of the deployment as a whole.

members.name: errorInformation
members.documentation: Information about any error associated with this deployment.

members.name: createTime
members.documentation: A timestamp indicating when the deployment was created.

members.name: startTime
members.documentation:
A timestamp indicating when the deployment began deploying to the deployment group.

Note that in some cases, the reported value of the start time may be later than the complete time. This is due to differences in the clock settings of various back-end servers that participate in the overall deployment process.

members.name: completeTime
members.documentation: A timestamp indicating when the deployment was completed.

members.name: deploymentOverview
members.documentation: A summary of the deployment status of the instances in the deployment.

members.name: description
members.documentation: A comment about the deployment.

members.name: creator
members.documentation:
How the deployment was created:

  • user: A user created the deployment.
  • autoscaling: Auto Scaling created the deployment.

members.name: ignoreApplicationStopFailures
members.documentation:
If true, then if the deployment causes the ApplicationStop deployment lifecycle event to fail to a specific instance, the deployment will not be considered to have failed to that instance at that point and will continue on to the BeforeInstall deployment lifecycle event.

If false or not specified, then if the deployment causes the ApplicationStop deployment lifecycle event to fail to a specific instance, the deployment will stop to that instance, and the deployment to that instance will be considered to have failed.

DeploymentLimitExceededException.documentation: The number of allowed deployments was exceeded.

DeploymentNotStartedException.documentation: The specified deployment has not started.

DeploymentOverview.documentation: Information about the deployment status of the instances in the deployment.

members.name: Pending
members.documentation: The number of instances that are pending in the deployment.

members.name: InProgress
members.documentation: The number of instances that are in progress in the deployment.

members.name: Succeeded
members.documentation: The number of instances that have succeeded in the deployment.

members.name: Failed
members.documentation: The number of instances that have failed in the deployment.

members.name: Skipped
members.documentation: The number of instances that have been skipped in the deployment.

DeregisterOnPremisesInstanceInput.documentation: Represents the input of a deregister on-premises instance operation.

members.name: instanceName
members.documentation: The name of the on-premises instance to deregister.

DescriptionTooLongException.documentation: The description that was provided is too long.

Diagnostics.documentation: Diagnostic information about executable scripts that are part of a deployment.

members.name: errorCode
members.documentation:
The associated error code:

  • Success: The specified script ran.
  • ScriptMissing: The specified script was not found in the specified location.
  • ScriptNotExecutable: The specified script is not a recognized executable file type.
  • ScriptTimedOut: The specified script did not finish running in the specified time period.
  • ScriptFailed: The specified script failed to run as expected.
  • UnknownError: The specified script did not run for an unknown reason.

members.name: scriptName
members.documentation: The name of the script.

members.name: message
members.documentation: The message associated with the error.

members.name: logTail
members.documentation: The last portion of the associated diagnostic log.

members.name: Key
members.documentation: The tag filter key.

members.name: Value
members.documentation: The tag filter value.

members.name: Type
members.documentation:
The tag filter type:

  • KEY_ONLY: Key only.
  • VALUE_ONLY: Value only.
  • KEY_AND_VALUE: Key and value.

members.name: code
members.documentation:
The error code:

  • APPLICATION_MISSING: The application was missing. Note that this error code will most likely be raised if the application is deleted after the deployment is created but before it starts.
  • DEPLOYMENT_GROUP_MISSING: The deployment group was missing. Note that this error code will most likely be raised if the deployment group is deleted after the deployment is created but before it starts.
  • HEALTH_CONSTRAINTS: The deployment failed on too many instances to be able to successfully deploy within the specified instance health constraints.
  • HEALTH_CONSTRAINTS_INVALID: The revision can never successfully deploy within the instance health constraints as specified.
  • IAM_ROLE_MISSING: The service role cannot be accessed.
  • IAM_ROLE_PERMISSIONS: The service role does not have the correct permissions.
  • INTERNAL_ERROR: There was an internal error.
  • NO_EC2_SUBSCRIPTION: The calling account is not subscribed to the Amazon EC2 service.
  • NO_INSTANCES: No instances were specified, or no instances can be found.
  • OVER_MAX_INSTANCES: The maximum number of instances was exceeded.
  • THROTTLED: The operation was throttled because the calling account exceeded the throttling limits of one or more AWS services.
  • TIMEOUT: The deployment has timed out.
  • REVISION_MISSING: The revision ID was missing. Note that this error code will most likely be raised if the revision is deleted after the deployment is created but before it starts.

members.name: message
members.documentation: An accompanying error message.

members.name: description
members.documentation: A comment about the revision.

members.name: deploymentGroups
members.documentation: A list of deployment groups that use this revision.

members.name: firstUsedTime
members.documentation: When the revision was first used by AWS CodeDeploy.

members.name: lastUsedTime
members.documentation: When the revision was last used by AWS CodeDeploy.

members.name: registerTime
members.documentation: When the revision was registered with AWS CodeDeploy.

members.name: revision

members.name: revisionInfo

GetDeploymentInstanceOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a get deployment instance operation.

members.documentation: Information about the instance.

GetDeploymentOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a get deployment operation.

members.name: deploymentInfo
members.documentation: Information about the deployment.

members.name: instanceName
members.documentation: The name of the on-premises instance to get information about

GetOnPremisesInstanceOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a get on-premises instance operation.

members.name: instanceInfo
members.documentation: Information about the on-premises instance.

GitHubLocation.documentation: Information about the location of application artifacts that are stored in GitHub.

members.name: repository
members.documentation:
The GitHub account and repository pair that stores a reference to the commit that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

Specified as account/repository.

members.name: commitId
members.documentation: The SHA1 commit ID of the GitHub commit that references the that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

IamUserArnAlreadyRegisteredException.documentation: The specified IAM user ARN is already registered with an on-premises instance.

IamUserArnRequiredException.documentation: An IAM user ARN was not specified.

InstanceDoesNotExistException.documentation: The specified instance does not exist in the deployment group.

InstanceIdRequiredException.documentation: The instance ID was not specified.

members.name: instanceName
members.documentation: The name of the on-premises instance.

members.name: iamUserArn
members.documentation: The IAM user ARN associated with the on-premises instance.

members.name: instanceArn
members.documentation: The ARN of the on-premises instance.

members.name: registerTime
members.documentation: The time that the on-premises instance was registered.

members.name: deregisterTime
members.documentation: If the on-premises instance was deregistered, the time that the on-premises instance was deregistered.

members.name: tags
members.documentation: The tags that are currently associated with the on-premises instance.

InstanceLimitExceededException.documentation: The maximum number of allowed on-premises instances in a single call was exceeded.

InstanceNameAlreadyRegisteredException.documentation: The specified on-premises instance name is already registered.

InstanceNameRequiredException.documentation: An on-premises instance name was not specified.

InstanceNotRegisteredException.documentation: The specified on-premises instance is not registered.

InstanceSummary.documentation: Information about an instance in a deployment.

members.name: deploymentId
members.documentation: The deployment ID.

members.name: instanceId
members.documentation: The instance ID.

members.name: status
members.documentation:
The deployment status for this instance:

  • Pending: The deployment is pending for this instance.
  • In Progress: The deployment is in progress for this instance.
  • Succeeded: The deployment has succeeded for this instance.
  • Failed: The deployment has failed for this instance.
  • Skipped: The deployment has been skipped for this instance.
  • Unknown: The deployment status is unknown for this instance.

members.name: lastUpdatedAt
members.documentation: A timestamp indicating when the instance information was last updated.

members.name: lifecycleEvents
members.documentation: A list of lifecycle events for this instance.

InvalidApplicationNameException.documentation: The application name was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidAutoScalingGroupException.documentation: The Auto Scaling group was specified in an invalid format or does not exist.

InvalidBucketNameFilterException.documentation: The bucket name either doesn't exist or was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidDeployedStateFilterException.documentation: The deployed state filter was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidDeploymentConfigNameException.documentation: The deployment configuration name was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidDeploymentGroupNameException.documentation: The deployment group name was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidDeploymentIdException.documentation: At least one of the deployment IDs was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidDeploymentStatusException.documentation: The specified deployment status doesn't exist or cannot be determined.

InvalidEC2TagException.documentation: The tag was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidIamUserArnException.documentation: The IAM user ARN was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidInstanceNameException.documentation: The specified on-premises instance name was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidInstanceStatusException.documentation: The specified instance status does not exist.

InvalidKeyPrefixFilterException.documentation: The specified key prefix filter was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidMinimumHealthyHostValueException.documentation: The minimum healthy instances value was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidNextTokenException.documentation: The next token was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidRegistrationStatusException.documentation: The registration status was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidRevisionException.documentation: The revision was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidRoleException.documentation: The service role ARN was specified in an invalid format. Or, if an Auto Scaling group was specified, the specified service role does not grant the appropriate permissions to Auto Scaling.

InvalidSortByException.documentation: The column name to sort by is either not present or was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidSortOrderException.documentation: The sort order was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidTagException.documentation: The specified tag was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidTagFilterException.documentation: The specified tag filter was specified in an invalid format.

InvalidTimeRangeException.documentation: The specified time range was specified in an invalid format.

LifecycleEvent.documentation: Information about a deployment lifecycle event.

members.name: lifecycleEventName
members.documentation: The deployment lifecycle event name, such as ApplicationStop, BeforeInstall, AfterInstall, ApplicationStart, or ValidateService.

members.name: diagnostics
members.documentation: Diagnostic information about the deployment lifecycle event.

members.name: startTime
members.documentation: A timestamp indicating when the deployment lifecycle event started.

members.name: endTime
members.documentation: A timestamp indicating when the deployment lifecycle event ended.

members.name: status
members.documentation:
The deployment lifecycle event status:

  • Pending: The deployment lifecycle event is pending.
  • InProgress: The deployment lifecycle event is in progress.
  • Succeeded: The deployment lifecycle event has succeeded.
  • Failed: The deployment lifecycle event has failed.
  • Skipped: The deployment lifecycle event has been skipped.
  • Unknown: The deployment lifecycle event is unknown.

ListApplicationRevisionsInput.documentation: Represents the input of a list application revisions operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The name of an existing AWS CodeDeploy application associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

members.name: sortBy
members.documentation:
The column name to sort the list results by:

  • registerTime: Sort the list results by when the revisions were registered with AWS CodeDeploy.
  • firstUsedTime: Sort the list results by when the revisions were first used by in a deployment.
  • lastUsedTime: Sort the list results by when the revisions were last used in a deployment.

If not specified or set to null, the results will be returned in an arbitrary order.

members.name: sortOrder
members.documentation:
The order to sort the list results by:

  • ascending: Sort the list of results in ascending order.
  • descending: Sort the list of results in descending order.

If not specified, the results will be sorted in ascending order.

If set to null, the results will be sorted in an arbitrary order.

members.name: s3Bucket
members.documentation:
A specific Amazon S3 bucket name to limit the search for revisions.

If set to null, then all of the user's buckets will be searched.

members.name: s3KeyPrefix
members.documentation: A specific key prefix for the set of Amazon S3 objects to limit the search for revisions.

members.name: deployed
members.documentation:
Whether to list revisions based on whether the revision is the target revision of an deployment group:

  • include: List revisions that are target revisions of a deployment group.
  • exclude: Do not list revisions that are target revisions of a deployment group.
  • ignore: List all revisions, regardless of whether they are target revisions of a deployment group.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous list application revisions call, which can be used to return the next set of applications in the list.

ListApplicationRevisionsOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a list application revisions operation.

members.name: revisions
members.documentation: A list of revision locations that contain the matching revisions.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: If the amount of information that is returned is significantly large, an identifier will also be returned, which can be used in a subsequent list application revisions call to return the next set of application revisions in the list.

ListApplicationsInput.documentation: Represents the input of a list applications operation.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous list applications call, which can be used to return the next set of applications in the list.

ListApplicationsOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a list applications operation.

members.name: applications
members.documentation: A list of application names.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: If the amount of information that is returned is significantly large, an identifier will also be returned, which can be used in a subsequent list applications call to return the next set of applications in the list.

ListDeploymentConfigsInput.documentation: Represents the input of a list deployment configurations operation.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous list deployment configurations call, which can be used to return the next set of deployment configurations in the list.

ListDeploymentConfigsOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a list deployment configurations operation.

members.name: deploymentConfigsList
members.documentation: A list of deployment configurations, including the built-in configurations such as CodeDeployDefault.OneAtATime.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: If the amount of information that is returned is significantly large, an identifier will also be returned, which can be used in a subsequent list deployment configurations call to return the next set of deployment configurations in the list.

ListDeploymentGroupsInput.documentation: Represents the input of a list deployment groups operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The name of an existing AWS CodeDeploy application associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous list deployment groups call, which can be used to return the next set of deployment groups in the list.

ListDeploymentGroupsOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a list deployment groups operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The application name.

members.name: deploymentGroups
members.documentation: A list of corresponding deployment group names.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: If the amount of information that is returned is significantly large, an identifier will also be returned, which can be used in a subsequent list deployment groups call to return the next set of deployment groups in the list.

ListDeploymentInstancesInput.documentation: Represents the input of a list deployment instances operation.

members.name: deploymentId
members.documentation: The unique ID of a deployment.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous list deployment instances call, which can be used to return the next set of deployment instances in the list.

members.name: instanceStatusFilter
members.documentation:
A subset of instances to list, by status:

  • Pending: Include in the resulting list those instances with pending deployments.
  • InProgress: Include in the resulting list those instances with in-progress deployments.
  • Succeeded: Include in the resulting list those instances with succeeded deployments.
  • Failed: Include in the resulting list those instances with failed deployments.
  • Skipped: Include in the resulting list those instances with skipped deployments.
  • Unknown: Include in the resulting list those instances with deployments in an unknown state.

ListDeploymentInstancesOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a list deployment instances operation.

members.name: instancesList
members.documentation: A list of instances IDs.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: If the amount of information that is returned is significantly large, an identifier will also be returned, which can be used in a subsequent list deployment instances call to return the next set of deployment instances in the list.

ListDeploymentsInput.documentation: Represents the input of a list deployments operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The name of an existing AWS CodeDeploy application associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

members.name: deploymentGroupName
members.documentation: The name of an existing deployment group for the specified application.

members.name: includeOnlyStatuses
members.documentation:
A subset of deployments to list, by status:

  • Created: Include in the resulting list created deployments.
  • Queued: Include in the resulting list queued deployments.
  • In Progress: Include in the resulting list in-progress deployments.
  • Succeeded: Include in the resulting list succeeded deployments.
  • Failed: Include in the resulting list failed deployments.
  • Aborted: Include in the resulting list aborted deployments.

members.name: createTimeRange
members.documentation: A deployment creation start- and end-time range for returning a subset of the list of deployments.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous list deployments call, which can be used to return the next set of deployments in the list.

ListDeploymentsOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a list deployments operation.

members.name: deployments
members.documentation: A list of deployment IDs.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: If the amount of information that is returned is significantly large, an identifier will also be returned, which can be used in a subsequent list deployments call to return the next set of deployments in the list.

ListOnPremisesInstancesInput.documentation:
Represents the input of a list on-premises instances operation.

.

members.name: registrationStatus
members.documentation:
The on-premises instances registration status:

  • Deregistered: Include in the resulting list deregistered on-premises instances.
  • Registered: Include in the resulting list registered on-premises instances.

members.name: tagFilters
members.documentation: The on-premises instance tags that will be used to restrict the corresponding on-premises instance names that are returned.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: An identifier that was returned from the previous list on-premises instances call, which can be used to return the next set of on-premises instances in the list.

ListOnPremisesInstancesOutput.documentation: Represents the output of list on-premises instances operation.

members.name: instanceNames
members.documentation: The list of matching on-premises instance names.

members.name: nextToken
members.documentation: If the amount of information that is returned is significantly large, an identifier will also be returned, which can be used in a subsequent list on-premises instances call to return the next set of on-premises instances in the list.

members.name: value
members.documentation: The minimum healthy instances value.

members.name: type
members.documentation:
The minimum healthy instances type:

  • HOST_COUNT: The minimum number of healthy instances, as an absolute value.
  • FLEET_PERCENT: The minimum number of healthy instances, as a percentage of the total number of instances in the deployment.

For example, for 9 instances, if a HOST_COUNT of 6 is specified, deploy to up to 3 instances at a time. The deployment succeeds if 6 or more instances are successfully deployed to; otherwise, the deployment fails. If a FLEET_PERCENT of 40 is specified, deploy to up to 5 instances at a time. The deployment succeeds if 4 or more instances are successfully deployed to; otherwise, the deployment fails.

In a call to the get deployment configuration operation, CodeDeployDefault.OneAtATime will return a minimum healthy instances type of MOST_CONCURRENCY and a value of 1. This means a deployment to only one instances at a time. (You cannot set the type to MOST_CONCURRENCY, only to HOST_COUNT or FLEET_PERCENT.)

RegisterApplicationRevisionInput.documentation: Represents the input of a register application revision operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The name of an existing AWS CodeDeploy application associated with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

members.name: description
members.documentation: A comment about the revision.

members.name: revision
members.documentation: Information about the application revision to register, including the revision's type and its location.

RegisterOnPremisesInstanceInput.documentation: Represents the input of register on-premises instance operation.

members.name: instanceName
members.documentation: The name of the on-premises instance to register.

members.name: iamUserArn
members.documentation: The ARN of the IAM user to associate with the on-premises instance.

RemoveTagsFromOnPremisesInstancesInput.documentation: Represents the input of a remove tags from on-premises instances operation.

members.name: tags
members.documentation: The tag key-value pairs to remove from the on-premises instances.

members.name: instanceNames
members.documentation: The names of the on-premises instances to remove tags from.

RevisionDoesNotExistException.documentation: The named revision does not exist with the applicable IAM user or AWS account.

RevisionLocation.documentation: Information about an application revision's location.

members.name: revisionType
members.documentation:
The application revision's type:

  • S3: An application revision stored in Amazon S3.
  • GitHub: An application revision stored in GitHub.

RevisionRequiredException.documentation: The revision ID was not specified.

RoleRequiredException.documentation: The role ID was not specified.

S3Location.documentation: Information about the location of application artifacts that are stored in Amazon S3.

members.name: bucket
members.documentation: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the application revision is stored.

members.name: key
members.documentation: The name of the Amazon S3 object that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

members.name: bundleType
members.documentation:
The file type of the application revision. Must be one of the following:

  • tar: A tar archive file.
  • tgz: A compressed tar archive file.
  • zip: A zip archive file.

members.name: version
members.documentation:
A specific version of the Amazon S3 object that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

If the version is not specified, the system will use the most recent version by default.

members.name: eTag
members.documentation:
The ETag of the Amazon S3 object that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

If the ETag is not specified as an input parameter, ETag validation of the object will be skipped.

StopDeploymentInput.documentation: Represents the input of a stop deployment operation.

members.name: deploymentId
members.documentation: The unique ID of a deployment.

StopDeploymentOutput.documentation: Represents the output of a stop deployment operation.

members.name: status
members.documentation:
The status of the stop deployment operation:

  • Pending: The stop operation is pending.
  • Succeeded: The stop operation succeeded.

members.name: statusMessage
members.documentation: An accompanying status message.

members.name: Key
members.documentation: The tag's key.

members.name: Value
members.documentation: The tag's value.

TagFilter.documentation: Information about an on-premises instance tag filter.

members.name: Key
members.documentation: The on-premises instance tag filter key.

members.name: Value
members.documentation: The on-premises instance tag filter value.

members.name: Type
members.documentation:
The on-premises instance tag filter type:

  • KEY_ONLY: Key only.
  • VALUE_ONLY: Value only.
  • KEY_AND_VALUE: Key and value.

TagLimitExceededException.documentation: The maximum allowed number of tags was exceeded.

members.name: start
members.documentation:
The time range's start time.

Specify null to leave the time range's start time open-ended.

members.name: end
members.documentation:
The time range's end time.

Specify null to leave the time range's end time open-ended.

UpdateApplicationInput.documentation: Represents the input of an update application operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The current name of the application that you want to change.

members.name: newApplicationName
members.documentation: The new name that you want to change the application to.

UpdateDeploymentGroupInput.documentation: Represents the input of an update deployment group operation.

members.name: applicationName
members.documentation: The application name corresponding to the deployment group to update.

members.name: currentDeploymentGroupName
members.documentation: The current name of the existing deployment group.

members.name: newDeploymentGroupName
members.documentation: The new name of the deployment group, if you want to change it.

members.name: deploymentConfigName
members.documentation: The replacement deployment configuration name to use, if you want to change it.

members.name: ec2TagFilters
members.documentation: The replacement set of Amazon EC2 tags to filter on, if you want to change them.

members.name: onPremisesInstanceTagFilters
members.documentation: The replacement set of on-premises instance tags for filter on, if you want to change them.

members.name: autoScalingGroups
members.documentation: The replacement list of Auto Scaling groups to be included in the deployment group, if you want to change them.

members.name: serviceRoleArn
members.documentation: A replacement service role's ARN, if you want to change it.

UpdateDeploymentGroupOutput.documentation: Represents the output of an update deployment group operation.

members.name: hooksNotCleanedUp
members.documentation: If the output contains no data, and the corresponding deployment group contained at least one Auto Scaling group, AWS CodeDeploy successfully removed all corresponding Auto Scaling lifecycle event hooks from the AWS account. If the output does contain data, AWS CodeDeploy could not remove some Auto Scaling lifecycle event hooks from the AWS account.
